intro: Chaerophyllum eriopodum, commonly known as the hairy cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist meadows and woodland edges. It has a fibrous root system and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it easily identifiable and ecologically significant in its habitat.
